choices.E: These four fields (FTP, ICMP, SNMP, and Telnet services) are collectively known as the Host Interface Priority.
choices.B: To enable these services (FTP ICMP, SNMP, and Telnet services), the enable host-in-path command must be executed from the superuser mode.
choices.C: To enable these services, the Session Border Controller includes a software license that enables administrative traffic over the media interfaces.
choices.A: By default, the Session Border Controller's FTP, ICMP, SNMP, and Telnet services cannot be accessed via the management interfaces.
choices.D: By default, the Session Border Controller's FTP, ICMP, SNMP, and Telnet services cannot be accessed via the media interfaces.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about the Host In Path (HIP) feature In the Session Border Controller?

discussion.content: No way... correct answer is D: not accessible on MEDIA interfaces by default...

Exactly!! By default, the Net-Net SBC’s FTP, ICMP, SNMP, and Telnet services cannot be
accessed via the media interfaces. https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E52358_01/doc/sbc_scx620_acliconfiguration.pdf Pg 96

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about SIP response code handling on the Session Border Controller? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A and E.
Calls Fail with "503 Service Unavailable," with Alarm "out of steering ports" on Oracle AP SBC : https://support.oracle.com/knowledge/Sun%20Microsystems/2162901_1.html

Also 503 is used for CAC (no available bandiwith) reason, not 403 (which is used when no route is available i.e. matched).

choices.B: The Session Border Controller will originate a 403 response when bandwidth allocated to a realm has been exhausted.
choices.C: The Session Border Controller cannot originate 3xx class redirect responses.
choices.E: The Session Border Controller can transmit a different SIP response code than it received.
choices.D: By default, the Session Border Controller will recurse on the 6xx messages.
choices.A: The Session Border Controller will originate a 503 when there are no steering pool ports available.

questions.question_text: Which action triggers the 180 Ringing response in a User Agent Client (UAC)?

choices.E: the termination of a SIP session
choices.C: the generation of a local ring-back tone
choices.B: the generation of a remote ring-back tone
choices.A: the subscription to a SIP presence service
choices.D: the establishment of a SIP session

discussion.content: C is the correct answer since UAC which sent INVITE receives 180. On receiving 180 it starts local ring back tone.
B is the right answer. The generation of the ring back tone to calling User agent is done by its local gateway, but this action is triggered after called party is ringing.
D, dispara una sesion establecida, en si el 180 es un tono de ring

comments.content: This is the correct answer and following the link proves it..

questions.question_text: Which SIP headers in an incoming SIP message to the Session Border Controller are used by a local-policy configuration element for routing?

discussion.content:
Correct answers: B and E
SBC do not replace routers
A y E, reemplazan a routers a nivel capa 5, señal y media

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe the functions of Session Border Controllers? (Choose two.)

choices.E: they provide signaling proxy functions for SIP, H.323, and MGCP, which includes access control, signaling constraints, and topology hiding
choices.A: they replace typical edge routers and firewalls in order to provide a unified network border for signaling and media control
choices.D: they provide routing functions for IP, TCP, and SMTP using application parameters
choices.B: they are session-aware devices that enable control of end-to-end interactive communications across IP network borders
choices.C: they are based on the Windows operating system
